result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance Q Durant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Detectable Amout of Controlled Substance), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served;  Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.
Conditions:  
*  Commit no new violations;
*  Pay all costs and all surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*  Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA sample.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On defendant's request and on motion of Attorney Dluzak Court grants Attorney Dluzak's motion to withdraw.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense request for another adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request.   Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj

Defendant Terrance Q Durant in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Terrance Q Durant in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
